rows.transcript_1:
Close your eyes.

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out five times.

Notice how you feel.

When you are ready, open your eyes again. You are in control!
rows.transcript_2:
Tutup mata anda.

Dengar nafas anda keluar dan masuk sebanyak lima kali.

Perhatikan apa yang anda rasa.

Bila anda sudah bersedia, buka semula mata anda. Anda memang boleh mengawalnya!
rows.title: In and out

text_1.eng: Take a moment to check in with yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Today‚Äôs skill is about spending one-on-one time with your child üòÉ

text_2.eng:
Spending special time with your child will make them feel valued and loved. üíô 

It also builds trust and respect, and helps your child learn new things. ‚ú®

rows.text_1_facilitator: Today‚Äôs skill is about spending one-on-one time with your child üòÉ
rows.text_2:
Spending special time with your child will make them feel valued and loved. üíô 

It also builds trust and respect, and helps your child learn new things. ‚ú®

text_1_facilitator.eng: Today, you will learn how one-on-one time works. Let‚Äôs begin with a question for our learning.

quiz_1_question.eng: True or False: When I spend special time with my child, I need to have a plan. I need to know what we will do together.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
‚ùå That is not correct. 

üß∏ You do not have to plan an activity. Your child can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
üéà You are right! 

üß∏ Your child can choose the activity as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1:
‚ùå That is not correct. 

üß∏ You do not have to plan an activity. Your child can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.

rows.quiz_1_question: True or False: When I spend special time with my child, I need to have a plan. I need to know what we will do together.
rows.text_1_facilitator: Today, you will learn how one-on-one time works. Let‚Äôs begin with a question for our learning.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Throughout this programme, you will also learn through some stories.

Here is our first one: @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name and her mother, @data.characters.f1_mother.name, are playing dress up during one-on-one time. Let‚Äôs see how they have fun together.

character_1_text.eng: I have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend with you, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: I want to play dress up!

Throughout this programme, you will also learn through some stories.

Here is our first one: @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name and her mother, @data.characters.f1_mother.name, are playing dress up during one-on-one time. Let‚Äôs see how they have fun together.
rows.character_1_text: I have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend with you, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: I want to play dress up!

character_1_text.eng: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it

rows.character_1_text: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it

character_1_text.eng: What a big girl you are, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name to get dressed by yourself!

rows.character_1_text: What a big girl you are, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name to get dressed by yourself!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
I will also provide you with tips that you can use anytime and anywhere!

3Ô∏è‚É£ Here are three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with your child: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
I will also provide you with tips that you can use anytime and anywhere!

3Ô∏è‚É£ Here are three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with your child: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.

section_1_text.eng:
Try to do it every day

‚è∞ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with your child each day

section_2_text.eng:
Let them choose the activity

‚è∞ Ask to spend time with your child.
‚öΩ Let them choose what to do or talk about.
üéàTry different activities together.
üòÉ Have fun!

section_3_text.eng:
Focus on your child

üì∫ Switch off the TV, put aside phones, and remove distractions.
üëÄ Look at your child. Nod or say ‚ÄúI see‚Äù to show you are really paying attention. 
üíõ Accept your child and avoid judgement.
üí° Respond to your child when they communicate with you. your child may use gestures, full sentences, movements, and sounds to communicate with you. It shows you are really paying attention to them.

rows.section_3_text:
Focus on your child

üì∫ Switch off the TV, put aside phones, and remove distractions.
üëÄ Look at your child. Nod or say ‚ÄúI see‚Äù to show you are really paying attention. 
üíõ Accept your child and avoid judgement.
üí° Respond to your child when they communicate with you. your child may use gestures, full sentences, movements, and sounds to communicate with you. It shows you are really paying attention to them.

text_1_facilitator.eng: At the end of each skill, I will have a home activity for you that you can try in your own time.

quiz_1_question.eng: ‚≠ê Your first home activity is to try to spend at least 5 minutes of quality one-on-one time with your child every day. It will make a huge difference! Do you have time to do it today? ‚è∞

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That‚Äôs great! You can use the tips you learnt today and have fun! Spending time with your child is a great way to form a positive relationship with them. üíô

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's OK! If you don't have time today, you can set some time aside tomorrow.
